_header: Man for mischief thou thee amend
_description: Story of the adulterous Falmouth Squire — 49 quatrains (abab)

BodRawPoe118.First Lines:
Man of þi myschefe þou þe amendeAnd to my termys
                    þou take goode hede…
BodRawPoe118.Last Lines:
…And graunt vs grace aftyr þi wylleTo be welwar of ffows
                    breche
BodRawPoe118.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Nachträge zu den Legenden 5: The Messengers of Death.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         79 (1887): 411-70: 419.
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 351-6; 558-64; 623.

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Man fro myscheff thou thee amend
                    And to my talkyng thou take god hede…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
Fro dedly synne God thee defende
                    And unto blys thi saull schall fare
                    Amen quod Rate…
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: Item 35b.

CULEe435a.First Lines:
The elder to hel toke the weyThe yonger to paradeys
                    vreyte…
CULEe435a.Last Lines:
…fro dedeley syn thaw the defendeAnd streyyt to bles they
                    sowle schall ffare

CULFf238.First Lines:
Man for myschefe þu þe amendeAnd to my talkyng þu
                    take gode hede…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…ffro dedely synne þu the defendeAnd streght to blys
                    þy soule shall fare

CULFf548.First Lines:
Man for thy myschif þu the amendAnd to my talkyng þu take
                    god [h]ede…
CULFf548.Last Lines:

                    þi saule shall fare

BLHar5396.First Lines: Man for myschefe þu þe amendeAnd to my talkyng þu take god hede…
BLHar5396.Last Lines: …ffro dedly synne þu þe defendeAnd streȝt to blysse þy sowle schall fare
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: A tale against [ ]edlock breking (added to upper margin by a later hand, f. 276)

Lam306.First Lines:
Man ffrome myschefe thou þe a mendeAnd to my talkynge thou
                    take gode hede…
Lam306.Last Lines:
…ffrom dedely synne thou the defendeAnd stryghte to blisse thi
                    soule shall fare
Lam306.Attributed Title:
Explicit (f. 110); a story of too skwyrys that were brethern the
                    wyche dwellyd here yn / ynglond yn the towne of ffalmowtht yn
                    Dorsetschere the tone / was dampnyd for brekyng of his wedlock the tother was
                    sauyd (f. 110, in a hand different from that of the scribe)
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 96-102; rev. ed. 126-32.

TokyoTak32.First Lines:
[m]an of thy myschef thee amendeAnd of this mater take good
                    hede…
TokyoTak32.Last Lines:
…That wee may with Awngelys bryghtteIn heuene blysse with
                    owten eende
TokyoTak32.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyht a tale of the dignite of / wedlok and of thee
                    perelis that is in / thee brekynge ther offe (f. 162v)
